items.title: Regional Weather Divide Pushes Spot Gas Prices Higher in East, Lower in West
items.summary: Spot gas prices were mostly higher in Friday trading for Saturday–Monday delivery as colder forecasts lifted demand expectations across the eastern United States, while losses persisted at hubs in the West.

items.title: Mild Winter, Healthy Supply Drive Natural Gas Futures to New Lows
items.summary: February Nymex natural gas futures crumbled Friday as market participants appeared unconvinced that weather for the remainder of winter would generate meaningful demand.

items.title: Midday Snapshot: Natural Gas Cash Prices Recover, Bolstered by Northeast Bounce
items.summary: Spot prices for natural gas delivered over the weekend and Monday were higher overall as of early afternoon on Friday. However, price direction varied by region amid weather uncertainty and strong supply. Physical prices had declined the day before.

items.title: Energy Transfer Boosts Spending Outlook to Relieve Permian’s Natural Gas Takeaway Constraints
items.summary: Energy Transfer LP (ET) could spend more this year on growth projects as it works to expand its natural gas network across the country.

items.title: Golden Pass LNG Cleared for Trident Pipeline Link to Permian Gas
items.summary: Golden Pass LNG has been authorized to build key pipeline facilities that would connect the terminal to up to 1 Bcf/d in Permian Basin feed gas supply on Kinder Morgan Inc.’s (KMI) Trident Intrastate Pipeline project.

items.title: Natural Gas Market Said Facing Storage Surplus Reality Check Amid Demand Pull
items.summary: The North American natural gas market entered 2026 with a constructive outlook, but a growing storage surplus could erode the price premium currently baked into the forward strip.

items.title: Norwegian Natural Gas Output Decline Widens Path for More U.S. LNG to Europe
items.summary: Norway’s oil and natural gas production is expected to fall before 2030 unless investments are made to maintain output from Europe’s top supplier, the Norwegian Offshore Directorate (NOD) warned in an annual update.

items.title: Weather Demand Weakness Weighs on Natural Gas Forward Prices
items.summary: Front-month natural gas forward prices retreated to begin the New Year, pressured by seasonally soft weather demand and persistently strong supply levels.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Permian Natural Gas Spot Prices Clawing Toward Positive
items.summary: Natural gas physical markets were edging higher early Friday, with Permian Basin spot prices probing positive territory even as futures markets extended losses.

items.title: Glenfarne Goes for Gold to Strengthen Alaska LNG Economics
items.summary: The developer of the Alaska LNG export terminal is pursuing a deal to supply natural gas to one of the largest gold mining operations in the state as a part of its strategy to improve the economics of the massive project.

items.title: Why Sanctions Relief Alone Won't Fix Venezuela's Oil Industry
items.summary: After the latest political shock in Venezuela, speculation has surged over the prospects of a recovery for the country’s oil industry. On paper, Venezuela still holds the world’s largest proven oil reserves. In reality, production remains a fraction

items.title: Lukoil’s Fire Sale and the New Era of Sanctions-by-Ownership
items.summary: Even as geopolitical developments, such as Venezuela and Iran, are making headlines, another major energy-related issue is currently being unwound. At present, the fire sale of Russian oil and gas giant Lukoil’s empire is ongoing, in the only way thi

items.title: Trump Tells Oil Executives Venezuela Deal Will Create “Tremendous Wealth”
items.summary: President Trump on Friday framed a sweeping new Venezuela oil deal as a once-in-a-generation opportunity for U.S. energy companies and the American economy, telling executives that the agreement would generate “tremendous wealth” for industry and “gr

items.title: Washington's Venezuelan Oil Push Falters on Funding Questions
items.summary: A week after President Donald Trump’s bold talk about U.S. oil majors “going in and spending billions” to revive Venezuela’s wrecked crude industry, the administration is now walking back the idea of direct U.S. cash backing for that effort, even as

items.title: New Year Starts With Fewer U.S. Oil and Gas Rigs
items.summary: The total number of active drilling rigs for oil and gas in the United States fell by 4 this week, according to new data that Baker Hughes published earlier this week, bringing the total rig count in the US  to 544 this week, down 40 from this same t
